pages.text: Advanced machines require more space to be assembled. For that, you might have to upgrade your $(l:zeithtech:basic_tier/basic_machine_assembler)$(thing)Basic Machine Assembler$().$(br)Unlike the basic tier, $(item)Advanced Machine Assembler$() is completely autonomous, and does not require hammer hitting it.

Moreover, it can also be automated with use of $(item)Recipe Patterns$(). Place one in the input slot, and perform an assembly, and the pattern will be encoded.$(br)This is the only item you can put inside the station automatically. After the pattern, external systems may place only one item for each slot used by the recipe.

Patterns, while being a useful automation method, have to be stored somewhere. This is where the $(item)Recipe Pattern Storage$() comes into play. It stores (reasonably) unlimited amount of patterns, that can be accessed by automation at any instant.
